text: Adrian Howard "Odie" Smith (born October 5, 1936) is an American former professional basketball player. He played as a point guard. He played for the Cincinnati Royals and the San Francisco Warriors of the National Basketball Association (NBA). In 1966, he was chosen for the NBA All-Star Game. Smith was named Most Valuable Player (MVP) of this game after he scored 24 points in 26 minutes. He was part of the U.S. team that won the gold medal at the 1960 Summer Olympics in Rome. He also won the gold medal for the U.S. team at the 1959 Pan American Games. Smith was born in Farmington, Kentucky. He played college basketball with the Kentucky Wildcats of the University of Kentucky. ==References== ==Other websites== * Adrian Smith at Basketball-Reference.com Category:1936 births Category:Living people Category:American bankers Category:American basketball players Category:Golden State Warriors players Category:Medalists at the 1960 Summer Olympics Category:Olympic gold medalists for the United States Category:Sacramento Kings players Category:Shooting guards Category:Sportspeople from Kentucky
title: Adrian Smith (basketball)
